meanings.definition: A person who is excessively concerned with their health and often complains about minor ailments.
meanings.sent1: Some valetudinarians spend a lot of time worrying about their health.
meanings.sent2: The valetudinarians in the waiting room were discussing their latest symptoms.
meanings.sent3: The group of valetudinarians at the park were comparing their vitamin regimens.
meanings.sent4: She was like a valetudinarian, always checking her pulse and temperature.
meanings.sent5: The image of a valetudinarian surrounded by pill bottles stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a person who is constantly preoccupied with their health.
meanings.sent1: Her valetudinarian habits included daily temperature checks.
meanings.sent2: The doctor noticed her valetudinarian behavior during the check-up.
meanings.sent3: The valetudinarian cat insisted on only eating organic food.
meanings.sent4: The garden was like a valetudinarian, always needing extra care and attention.
meanings.sent5: The valetudinarian mindset affected every decision she made about her health.
